snippet: Lawyers for Robel Phillipos, who is accused of lying to the authorities investigating the Boston Marathon attack, said he had nothing to do with the bombings.
abstract: Lawyers for former University of Massachusetts student Robel Phillipos, who is accused of lying to authorities investigating Boston Marathon bombings, seek his release from federal custody, saying he had nothing to do with bombings; Ruslan Tsarni, uncle of slain bombing suspect Tamerlan Tsarnaev, is unable to find cemetery willing to accept body for burial.

byline.original: By KATHARINE Q. SEELYE and JESS BIDGOOD
byline.contributor: Katharine Q. Seelye reported from Boston, and Jess Bidgood from Worcester, Mass.

lead_paragraph: Lawyers for Robel Phillipos, who is accused of lying to the authorities investigating the Boston Marathon attack, said he had nothing to do with the bombings.

headline.seo: Man Accused of Lying in Boston Bombings Seeks Release
headline.main: Man Accused of Lying Seeks Release as Cemeteries Reject Tsarnaev Family
headline.print_headline: Man Accused of Lying Seeks Release as Cemeteries Reject Tsarnaev Family
